params.name: walletActionId
params.doc: ID of the WalletAction to delete

docs.summary: Expire an WalletAction immediately and deducting the remaining balance from the gift card

params.name: walletActionId
params.doc: ID of the WalletAction to retrieve

docs.summary:
Query WalletActions using [WQL - Wix Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language)
Results will be enriched with calculated balances

Update an WalletAction, supports partial update
Pass the latest `revision` for a successful update

examples.title: updateWalletAction example
body: const result = await walletAction.updateWalletAction(id, walletAction, options);

members.name: walletAction
members.doc: WalletAction to be created

members.name: walletAction
members.doc: The created WalletAction

members.name: expression
members.doc:
Cron expression is a string of five space-separated sub-expressions.

* * * * *
| | | | |
minute of hour | | | day of week
hour of day | month of year
day of month

Field            Accepted values
-----            ---------------
minute of hour   0..59 / * ,
hour of day      0..23 / * ,
day of month     1..31 / * , W L
month of year    1..12 / * ,
day of week      0..7 MON..SUN / * W L #

Coma separates multiple values:
0,20,40 * * * * => on 0th, 20th and 40th minute
Slash selects every Nth value:
* /20 * * * * => equivalent to 0,20,40
5/20 * * * * => on 5th, 25th and 45th minute
W selects working days
0 2 * * W =>  2am on Mon..Fri
L selects the last day of ...
0 0 L * *    => last day of each month
0 0 LW * *   => last working day of each month
0 0 * * FRIL => midnight of the last Friday of the month
Hash selects Nth day of week
0 0 * * Mon#1 => midnight of the first Monday of the month

Following aliases are supported: @hourly, @daily, @weekly, @monthly

The first execution time will be evaluated based on the client invocation time (approximately the moment the
client call returns).
All executions will be evaluated in UTC.

Example:
00:19:59 - client schedules a task with cron = 0/20 * * * * (every 20-th minute of the hour)
00:20:02 - task reaches Time Capsule database
00:21:00 - task is executed by Time Capsule, the client is triggered with a ~1 minute delay
00:40:00 - task is executed by Time Capsule according to the schedule with no delay

members.name: timeZone
members.doc:
IANA regional time zone ID.
For example "America/New_York", "Asia/Jerusalem", "Europe/Kyiv", "Europe/Vilnius", etc..
Equivalent to "UTC" if omitted.

description: A message containing a cron expression and a timeZone against which the expression should be evaluated

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through the result pages using `next` and `prev`. Returned if cursor paging is used.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Task id

members.name: cron
members.doc: Deprecated. Equivalent to cronTz(cron, "UTC")

members.name: cronTz
members.doc: A trigger defined by a cron expression and an optional time zone

members.name: oneTime
members.doc: A trigger which will fire once at a specified timestamp

members.name: payload
members.doc: Task payload

members.name: scheduledFor
members.doc: The time when this task is scheduled to trigger. For reoccurring tasks, this will be hold the next time this task will run and will be updated after every run

members.name: topic
members.doc: A Greyhound topic to which the task will be produced when triggered

members.name: key
members.doc:
A free-form string that together with `namespace` and `task_type` uniquely identifies a task.
When there is an entity involved, setting this to be equal to the ID of an entity related to the task is a good option.

members.name: namespace
members.doc: A unique identifier of an application or a source that define the task. In most cases this would be the appDefId

members.name: taskType
members.doc:
A free-form string distinguishing different families of tasks within a namespace.
For example: "send-promo-email", "ClearTrashBin", "premium expiration reminder"

members.name: cron
members.doc: Deprecated. Equivalent to cronTz(cron, "UTC")

members.name: cronTz
members.doc: A trigger defined by a cron expression and an optional time zone

members.name: oneTime
members.doc: A trigger which will fire once at a specified timestamp

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. For an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Represents the time when the walletAction's amount will be added to the account

members.name: status
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ACTIVE'`
- `'DISABLED'`
- `'EXPIRED'`
- `'PENDING'`
